title: China holds key lending rates as softening consumer sentiment persists in world's second largest economy
description: The People's Bank of China held the 1-year loan prime rate at 3.0% and 5-year LPR at 3.5%.

description: President Donald Trump's 'reciprocal" tariff deadline has shifted since April 2, but White House officials insist that Aug. 1 is a firm deadline.

title: PM Modi To Visit UK, Maldives From July 23-26
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will pay a four-day visit to the United Kingdom and the Maldives from Wednesday.

title: Several Injured As Car Crashes Into Barn's Roof In Germany
description: Police in northwestern Germany on Sunday said that several people were injured when a car veered off a road, hit a 7-year-old boy on a trampoline and went flying into a barn roof on its side.

title: Syria conflict: 'Cautious calm' returns to Sweida; Druze-Bedouin fighting killed over 1,100
description: A fragile calm has settled over Sweida, Southern Syria, after a week of intense sectarian violence that claimed over 1,100 lives. A ceasefire, brokered after multiple failed attempts, is holding between Druze factions and Sunni Bedouin rivals. Government forces have secured parts of the province, and humanitarian aid has begun to arrive.
author: TOI World Desk

title: US faces first megafire risk of 2025: Oregon wildfire burns over 95,000 acres; more than 900 firefighters work on containment
description: Oregon's Cram Fire, the largest US wildfire this year, has consumed over 95,740 acres, with 49% containment achieved. Over 900 emergency personnel are battling the blaze, which destroyed homes and triggered evacuations. Favorable weather is aiding efforts, but the fire would become a megafire if it reaches the 100,000 acres mark.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Arrested Kenyan activist Boniface Mwangi faces terror charges
description: Mwangi accused of ‘facilitation of terrorist acts’ during last month’s protests against government of William RutoThe Kenyan rights activist Boniface Mwangi is accused of “facilitation of terrorist acts” during protests that rocked the country last month, investigators said on Sunday, a day after he was arrested.At least 19 people were killed during the 25 June demonstration against President William Ruto’s government, which was itself called to pay tribute to victims of police violence at another protest on the same date last year. Continue reading...
author: Agence France-Presse in Nairobi

title: Malaria ‘back with a vengeance’ in Zimbabwe as number of deaths from the disease triple
description: Withdrawal of USAID funds threatens decades of progress, say experts, with cuts to research and shortage of mosquito nets putting thousands at risk across the countryZimbabwe’s efforts to control malaria have been dealt a huge blow as experts say the disease has returned “with a vengeance” after US aid cuts, with 115 outbreaks recorded in 2025 compared with only one last year.The sharp rise in cases comes six months after Donald Trump halted critical funding for US research and national response programmes. Continue reading...
author: Farai Shawn Matiashe

title: Israeli forces kill 67 Palestinians seeking aid in northern Gaza, Hamas-run ministry says
description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said it had "fired warning shots" and disputed the number of reported deaths.

description: The result could destabilise Japan's government at a pivotal moment in trade negotiations with the US.

title: Japan’s ruling party projected to lose majority in upper house of parliament
